text: 1. Learn about risks and dangers
source_text: 1. Learn about risks and dangers

text: • Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
source_text: • Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.

text: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography
source_text: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography

text: • Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
source_text: • Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.

text: • Cyberbullying from other young people and strangers.
source_text: • Cyberbullying from other young people and strangers.

text: 2. Tech fixes to protect your children online:
source_text: 2. Tech fixes to protect your children online:

text: • Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.
source_text: • Turn on SafeSearch on your browser to filter adult content.

text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/entertainment-search-engines/
source_text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/entertainment-search-engines/

text: • Set up parental controls.
source_text: • Set up parental controls.

text: https://www.internetmatters.org/parental-controls/
source_text: https://www.internetmatters.org/parental-controls/

text: • Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.
source_text: • Set up strict privacy settings on online apps and games.

text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/
source_text: https://www.internetmatters.org/blog/parental-controls/social-media/

text: • Cover webcams when not in use.
source_text: • Cover webcams when not in use.

text: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits:
source_text: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits:

text: Involve your child or teen in creating family tech agreements about healthy device use.
source_text: Involve your child or teen in creating family tech agreements about healthy device use.

text: Create device-free spaces and times in your house
source_text: Create device-free spaces and times in your house

text: (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
source_text: (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).

text: Child tech agreement: https://www.esafety.gov.au/sites/default/files/2020-01/Our%20Family%20Tech%20Agreement_0.pdf
source_text: Child tech agreement: https://www.esafety.gov.au/sites/default/files/2020-01/Our%20Family%20Tech%20Agreement_0.pdf

text: Teen tech agreement: https://www.childnet.com/ufiles/Family-Agreement.pdf
source_text: Teen tech agreement: https://www.childnet.com/ufiles/Family-Agreement.pdf

text: Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!
source_text: Help your child learn how to keep personal information private, especially from strangers – some people are not who they say they are!

text: Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
source_text: Remind your children that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).

text: Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.
source_text: Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.

text: This does not mean we should ban our children from spending time online. It just means that we need to learn how to protect them in a new world.
source_text: This does not mean we should ban our children from spending time online. It just means that we need to learn how to protect them in a new world.

text: 4. Spend time with your child or teen online
source_text: 4. Spend time with your child or teen online

text: Get to know how your child experiences the digital world.
source_text: Get to know how your child experiences the digital world.

text: Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.
source_text: Explore websites, social media, games, and apps together.

text: Talk to your teen on how to report things that aren't OK.
source_text: Talk to your teen on how to report things that aren't OK.

text: Common Sense Media has great advice for apps, games and entertainment for different ages.
source_text: Common Sense Media has great advice for apps, games and entertainment for different ages.

text: https://www.commonsensemedia.org/app-reviews
source_text: https://www.commonsensemedia.org/app-reviews

text: 5. Build open communication and trusting relationships
source_text: 5. Build open communication and trusting relationships

text: Tell your children that if they experience something online (or anywhere) that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.
source_text: Tell your children that if they experience something online (or anywhere) that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.

text: 6. Report and seek help
source_text: 6. Report and seek help

text: INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals and the Child Helpline in your country to get support if you or your children experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.
source_text: INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals and the Child Helpline in your country to get support if you or your children experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.

text: INHOPE Hotlines: https://www.inhope.org/EN#hotlineReferral

text: Child Helpline: https://www.childhelplineinternational.org/
source_text: Child Helpline: https://www.childhelplineinternational.org/

text: Step 2. Be Specific, Positive, and Realistic!
source_text: Step 2. Be Specific, Positive, and Realistic!

text: Describe exactly what you want your child to do. Say, 'Please wash your hands for 20 seconds before coming to dinner, instead of 'Wash your hands.'
source_text: Describe exactly what you want your child to do. Say, 'Please wash your hands for 20 seconds before coming to dinner, instead of 'Wash your hands.'

text: Step 3. Give Instructions One at a Time
source_text: Step 3. Give Instructions One at a Time

text: Children are much more likely to do what you ask if you break things up into smaller steps.
source_text: Children are much more likely to do what you ask if you break things up into smaller steps.

text: Step 1. Get Your Child's Attention
source_text: Step 1. Get Your Child's Attention

text: Look at your child and say their name when you give your child an instruction. Get down to their level.
source_text: Look at your child and say their name when you give your child an instruction. Get down to their level.

text: Step 4. Praise Your Children When They Follow Instructions
source_text: Step 4. Praise Your Children When They Follow Instructions

text: They will feel good about it and be more likely to follow instructions in the future!
source_text: They will feel good about it and be more likely to follow instructions in the future!

text: Use positive words when telling your child what to do. Say, ‘Please put your clothes away in the cupboard,’ instead of ‘Don’t make a mess’.

text: Hello! We love our children and teenagers, but stress from caregiving, money, and COVID-19 can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.

text: Stress from caregiving can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.
source_text: Stress from caregiving can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.

text: Here's a video to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
source_text: Here's a video to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.

text: Think about what makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?
source_text: Think about what makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?

text: Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
source_text: Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.

text: Here's an audio message to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
source_text: Here's an audio message to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.

text: Here are some things that can prevent bad things from happening when you are angry:
source_text: Here are some things that can prevent bad things from happening when you are angry:

text: 1. Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.
source_text: 1. Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.

text: 2. Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others? Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.
source_text: 2. Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others? Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.

text: 3. It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.
source_text: 3. It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.

text: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Learning how to manage your anger can help you  avoid some difficult situations.
source_text: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Learning how to manage your anger can help you  avoid some difficult situations.

text: Hi! Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.
source_text: Hi! Managing anger can be really difficult. Take a break when you feel you are getting angry at your children or someone else.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Relax - CheckIn - Anger management
text: Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!
source_text: Go somewhere else for 5 minutes to regain control of your emotions. If you have safe outdoor space, go outside. You can get through this!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Relax - CheckIn - Anger management
text: Hi! Managing anger can be really difficult. Did you know that research shows if you control your anger or do something positive, you increase your child's brain development? Be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!

text: Sit comfortably and close your eyes. Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:

text: Here's an audio message to guide you through a fun physical activity!
source_text: Here's an audio message to guide you through a fun physical activity!

text: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
source_text: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.

text: Here's a fun video of a physical activity that can help you release stress and keep healthy!
source_text: Here's a fun video of a physical activity that can help you release stress and keep healthy!

text: Let your hand hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
source_text: Let your hand hang by your side. Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you relax your body.

text: Relax your arms and let your arms to swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
source_text: Relax your arms and let your arms to swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.

text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
source_text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.

text: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
source_text: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!

text: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
source_text: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.

text: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes or a bit more? You can even make household chores into a game to do together. Even 5 minutes can make a big difference!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
source_text: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to physically do, you can simply watch your child. Try describing what they are doing like a sports announcer and praising what they do!
source_text: If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to physically do, you can simply watch your child. Try describing what they are doing like a sports announcer and praising what they do!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: Children often to want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. Sometimes you might want to give them some other fun options to do instead (Type: "Help" if you want a suggestion).
source_text: Children often to want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. Sometimes you might want to give them some other fun options to do instead (Type: "Help" if you want a suggestion).

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: You can also just sit next to your child while they are doing something they enjoy (like watching a T.V. show) and show them that you are interested in what they like. If you take their lead they will see that you care.
source_text: You can also just sit next to your child while they are doing something they enjoy (like watching a T.V. show) and show them that you are interested in what they like. If you take their lead they will see that you care.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: You can also find something educational to do together with your child on the gadget. Or maybe ask your child to show you what is their favourite thing to do on the gadget. Just be patient. Soon they may open up to other activities, too!
source_text: You can also find something educational to do together with your child on the gadget. Or maybe ask your child to show you what is their favourite thing to do on the gadget. Just be patient. Soon they may open up to other activities, too!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: Sometimes our children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. Explain why they can't, and try suggesting alternative activities that would be more appropriate. Type "Help" if you want a suggestion.
source_text: Sometimes our children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. Explain why they can't, and try suggesting alternative activities that would be more appropriate. Type "Help" if you want a suggestion.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: If your child is very young, it is normal for them to have a short attention span and want to do many things during One-on-One Time. Just accept your child and follow their lead moving from one activity to the next.
source_text: If your child is very young, it is normal for them to have a short attention span and want to do many things during One-on-One Time. Just accept your child and follow their lead moving from one activity to the next.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: The end of One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult for your child. Try giving your child a Transition Warning about a minute before the end of One-on-One Time: "In one minute, One-on-One Time will be over and it will be time to wash our hands before dinner..."
source_text: The end of One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult for your child. Try giving your child a Transition Warning about a minute before the end of One-on-One Time: "In one minute, One-on-One Time will be over and it will be time to wash our hands before dinner..."

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: It can be difficult to spend One-on-One Time with each one child when you have more than one child. If possible, you can ask another adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend One-on-One Time with one child.
source_text: It can be difficult to spend One-on-One Time with each one child when you have more than one child. If possible, you can ask another adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend One-on-One Time with one child.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: If your child is too young to understand how long a minute is, then you can set a number of time to repeat the activity: "5 more tries and then it will be time for wash our hands before dinner…"
source_text: If your child is too young to understand how long a minute is, then you can set a number of time to repeat the activity: "5 more tries and then it will be time for wash our hands before dinner…"

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: You can also spend One-on-One Time with all of your children at once!
source_text: You can also spend One-on-One Time with all of your children at once!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: Type "Help" for activities that you can do as a whole family
source_text: Type "Help" for activities that you can do as a whole family

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: We are sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulties spending One-on-One Time with your children. Please type "Help" for other advice that might be of use to you. Thank you for trying your best!
source_text: We are sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulties spending One-on-One Time with your children. Please type "Help" for other advice that might be of use to you. Thank you for trying your best!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank your child for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect your child to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.
source_text: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank your child for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect your child to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: You can also think of times when it would be easier to spend One-on-One Time each child, like later in the evening with an older child after the others have gone to sleep.
source_text: You can also think of times when it would be easier to spend One-on-One Time each child, like later in the evening with an older child after the others have gone to sleep.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
text: Competitive games can be challenging for children (and adults!) if they have difficulty losing. You may want to suggest other activities that you can play together instead of against each other (Type "Help" if you want a suggestion").
source_text: Competitive games can be challenging for children (and adults!) if they have difficulty losing. You may want to suggest other activities that you can play together instead of against each other (Type "Help" if you want a suggestion").

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Here's a video about spending one-on-one time with your baby!
source_text: Here's a video about spending one-on-one time with your baby!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: The first 1000 days of life are a window of opportunity for your baby. It is when their brain develops faster than any other time in their life. When you spend time with your baby, you build a healthy attachment between you both that will make them feel secure and loved.
source_text: The first 1000 days of life are a window of opportunity for your baby. It is when their brain develops faster than any other time in their life. When you spend time with your baby, you build a healthy attachment between you both that will make them feel secure and loved.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: It is normal to struggle to think of what to do with our babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.
source_text: It is normal to struggle to think of what to do with our babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Here are 7 easy tips to make One-on-One Time with your baby a success:
source_text: Here are 7 easy tips to make One-on-One Time with your baby a success:

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 1. Do it every day
source_text: 1. Do it every day

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 2. Be close to your baby
source_text: 2. Be close to your baby

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 3. Let your baby take the lead
source_text: 3. Let your baby take the lead

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 4. Observe and listen to your child
source_text: 4. Observe and listen to your child

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 5. Play with your baby
source_text: 5. Play with your baby

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 6. Talk to your baby
source_text: 6. Talk to your baby

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!
source_text: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 1. Do it every day!
source_text: 1. Do it every day!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Try to spend time playing with your baby every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.
source_text: Try to spend time playing with your baby every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 2. Be close to your child.
source_text: 2. Be close to your child.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.
source_text: Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 3. Let your baby take the lead
source_text: 3. Let your baby take the lead

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Remember that the world is brand new to your child!
source_text: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Remember that the world is brand new to your child!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 4. Observe your child.
source_text: 4. Observe your child.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: See what facial expressions your child is making. Notice what your child is interested in or looking at.
source_text: See what facial expressions your child is making. Notice what your child is interested in or looking at.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Give just enough help to let it be the child’s achievement. It is okay to play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative. If your child gets frustrated, you can reassure your child by gently stroking their back.
source_text: Give just enough help to let it be the child’s achievement. It is okay to play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative. If your child gets frustrated, you can reassure your child by gently stroking their back.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Listen to the sounds or words your child is making. You can even make the same sounds by copying your child!
source_text: Listen to the sounds or words your child is making. You can even make the same sounds by copying your child!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 5. Play with your baby
source_text: 5. Play with your baby

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through the five senses. Let your child use all of their senses when exploring the world. Sometimes when you read to your child, your child will want to put the book in their mouth. That is okay!
source_text: Babies learn through play! Help your child explore the world through the five senses. Let your child use all of their senses when exploring the world. Sometimes when you read to your child, your child will want to put the book in their mouth. That is okay!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 6. Talk to your baby
source_text: 6. Talk to your baby

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Start talking to your baby from the moment they are born (even before when they are in the womb). Did you know your baby can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!
source_text: Start talking to your baby from the moment they are born (even before when they are in the womb). Did you know your baby can even recognise their name at a very early age? Try saying your baby's name and notice how they respond!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: It is okay for your child to want to do many different things. Your child’s attention may wander to many different things during One-on-One Time. Anything that is happening can grab their attention: the sound of a siren, the feeling of a breeze, feelings in the body. Just keep your attention on your child.
source_text: It is okay for your child to want to do many different things. Your child’s attention may wander to many different things during One-on-One Time. Anything that is happening can grab their attention: the sound of a siren, the feeling of a breeze, feelings in the body. Just keep your attention on your child.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening. Speak with enthusiasm when describing what your child is doing.
source_text: Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening. Speak with enthusiasm when describing what your child is doing.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!
source_text: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time baby
text: Look for ways you can connect with your baby playfully during feeding, bathing, and dressing. You can even make bedtime a fun and nurturing experience for you and your baby in a calm way.
source_text: Look for ways you can connect with your baby playfully during feeding, bathing, and dressing. You can even make bedtime a fun and nurturing experience for you and your baby in a calm way.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: 1. Spend at least five minutes with each child
source_text: 1. Spend at least five minutes with each child

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: Even 5 minutes a day of quality time  makes a big difference. If you have more than one child, you can take turns or let each child choose an activity. It can be at the same time each day so your children look forward to it.
source_text: Even 5 minutes a day of quality time  makes a big difference. If you have more than one child, you can take turns or let each child choose an activity. It can be at the same time each day so your children look forward to it.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: 2. Give your child your full attention
source_text: 2. Give your child your full attention

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: Make sure you will not be interrupted. Switch off the TV and put your phone on silent. It will show your child, they are important.
source_text: Make sure you will not be interrupted. Switch off the TV and put your phone on silent. It will show your child, they are important.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: 4. Follow your child's lead
source_text: 4. Follow your child's lead

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative.
source_text: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: 3. Let your child choose the activity
source_text: 3. Let your child choose the activity

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: Ask your child what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?
source_text: Ask your child what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: Choosing builds their self confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t OK with COVID-19 rules, then this is a chance to talk with them about this.
source_text: Choosing builds their self confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t OK with COVID-19 rules, then this is a chance to talk with them about this.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: If your child cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.
source_text: If your child cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: 5. Use words to describe what your child is doing
source_text: 5. Use words to describe what your child is doing

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: Listening to your child is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what your child is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!
source_text: Listening to your child is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what your child is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: 6. Have fun!
source_text: 6. Have fun!

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time child
text: One-on-One Time with your child can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after playing with your child.
source_text: One-on-One Time with your child can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after playing with your child.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time teen
text: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with your teen each day. Choose a time when you and our teen will not be interrupted and when your teen does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.
source_text: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with your teen each day. Choose a time when you and our teen will not be interrupted and when your teen does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time teen
text: Try to do something different than watching TV or playing with a tablet/phone. However, you may need to at first join your teen and watch their favourite TV programme with them. They may feel comfortable doing other activities with time.

flow_name: PLH - Content - Time - One on one time teen
text: You can even try rephrasing back what your teen says when they speak to you. For example, when your teen says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.
